title: 820-00840-A 20V 485mA braindead?
message:
I'm working on a 820-00840-A that had a lot of water damage. Description from customer [I]"no more reaction. Water damage - the device was for a short time submerged in water"[/I].

After fixing all the damaged areas finally PP3V3_S0 was missing. I changed U7650 to fix this.
The board have 20V and uses at the beginning ca. 485mA, going up to ca. 600mA when the cpu-temperature get's up. The CPU gets warm, up to 55°C (needs ca. 1-2 minutes) measured on top of the cpu-cooler.
The board does not boot - chipmunk don't show any cpu-activity. Pushing SMC_ONOFF_R_L shows no reaction, it's not possible to shut down the board by pushing it 5 seconds or more. 

Here are my measurements:

PPBUS_G3H = 13,05V
PPDCIN_G3H = 20,41V
PP5V_S5 = 5,11V
PP3V3_G3H = 3,41V
PP3V3_S4 = 3,32V
PP3V3_S0 = 3,31V

PP1V_S0G = 0,99V
PP1V2_S0G = 1,20V
PP3V1_RTC = 3,09V
PP3V3_S5 = 3,32V
PP3V3_S5G = 3,32V
PP1V_S5G = 1,00V
PP1V8_S5G = 1,80V
PPVCCPCH_S5G = 1,00V
PP1V_S5GTD = 0,98V

PP3V3_S0 = 3,31V

PP3V3_S5_SSD_SNS = 3,32V

ALL_SYS_PWRGD = 3,21V

Maybe the picture of the thermal cam helps ...
[ATTACH]60453[/ATTACH]

title: 820-00840-A 20V 485mA braindead?
message:
Probably bad CPU.

"PPVCCCPU_S0G = 0,79V
PPVCCGT_S0G = 0,67V"
CPU core must drop to 0V when booting.
And iGPU voltage should not appear at all, until high graphics load is detected.
